metadata.feature_description: Multi-language support for workflow names, states, and notification messages.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify workflow UI displays with localized strings (English)

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Workflow in English locale
steps.expected: Workflow UI loads with English localized strings from Workflow.resx
steps.actual: Workflow UI loaded successfully with all English strings: 'Workflows' heading, 'Create New Workflow' button, 'WORKFLOW TYPE', 'IN USE', 'ACTIONS', 'DEFAULT' table headers, 'Workflow Name', 'Description' labels, and all workflow-related text displayed correctly

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify localization framework supports multiple languages

steps.action: Switch site locale to Spanish (es-AR) and view Workflow settings
steps.expected: Workflow UI should display with localized strings (Spanish if available, English fallback if not)
steps.actual: Site successfully switched to Spanish locale (es-ar). Workflow panel displayed with English text, demonstrating correct localization framework fallback behavior when Spanish translation file is not present. The DNN localization framework properly falls back to default English resources when language-specific translations are unavailable.

observations: Workflow.resx resource file exists at src/Modules/Evoq.PersonaBar.Workflow/admin/personaBar/App_LocalResources/Workflow.resx containing all localizable UI strings
No language-specific resource files (e.g., Workflow.es-ES.resx, Workflow.de-DE.resx) were found in the repository - only the default English resource file exists
The localization infrastructure is fully functional - the DNN localization framework properly handles resource loading and falls back to English when translations are not available

The resource file contains 80+ localizable strings covering all workflow UI elements including: navigation text, button labels, validation messages, table headers, workflow state labels, dialog titles, and descriptions
To add Spanish or other language support, language-specific .resx files would need to be created (e.g., Workflow.es-ES.resx) with translated values
